013package org.apache.juneau.assertions;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
017
018import java.io.*;
019import java.util.*;
020import java.util.function.*;
021import java.util.regex.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
026
027/**
028 * Used for fluent assertion calls against strings.
029 *
030 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
031 * <p class='bjava'>
032 *    <jc>// Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK".</jc>
033 *    <jv>client</jv>
034 *       .get(<jsf>URL</jsf>)
035 *       .run()
036 *       .assertContent().is(<js>"OK"</js>);
037 * </p>
038 *
039 *
040 * <h5 class='topic'>Test Methods</h5>
041 * <p>
042 * <ul class='javatree'>
043 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentStringAssertion}
044 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
045 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#is(String) is(String)}
046 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isNot(String) isNot(String)}
047 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isLines(String...) isLines(String...)}
048 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isSortedLines(String...) isSortedLines(String...)}
049 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isIc(String) isIc(String)}
050 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isNotIc(String) isNotIc(String)}
051 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isContains(String...) isContains(String...)}
052 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isNotContains(String...) isNotContains(String...)}
053 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isEmpty() isEmpty()}
054 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isNotEmpty() isNotEmpty()}
055 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isString(Object) isString(Object)}
056 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isMatches(String) isMatches(String)}
057 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isPattern(String) isPattern(String)}
058 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isPattern(String,int) isPattern(String,int)}
059 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isPattern(Pattern) isPattern(Pattern)}
060 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isStartsWith(String) isStartsWith(String)}
061 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isEndsWith(String) isEndsWith(String)}
062 *    </ul>
063 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
064 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
065 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExists() isExists()}
066 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Object) is(Object)}
067 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Predicate) is(Predicate)}
068 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNot(Object) isNot(Object)}
069 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isAny(Object...) isAny(Object...)}
070 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotAny(Object...) isNotAny(Object...)}
071 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNull() isNull()}
072 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotNull() isNotNull()}
073 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isString(String) isString(String)}
074 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isJson(String) isJson(String)}
075 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSame(Object) isSame(Object)}
076 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameJsonAs(Object) isSameJsonAs(Object)}
077 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSortedJsonAs(Object) isSameSortedJsonAs(Object)}
078 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer) isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer)}
079 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isType(Class) isType(Class)}
080 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExactType(Class) isExactType(Class)}
081 *    </ul>
082 * </ul>
083 *
084 * <h5 class='topic'>Transform Methods</h5>
085 * <p>
086 * <ul class='javatree'>
087 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentStringAssertion}
088 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
089 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asReplaceAll(String,String) asReplaceAll(String,String)}
090 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asReplace(String,String) asReplace(String,String)}
091 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asUrlDecode() asUrlDecode()}
092 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asLc() asLc()}
093 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asUc() asUc()}
094 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asLines() asLines()}
095 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asSplit(String) asSplit(String)}
096 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asLength() asLength()}
097 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asOneLine() asOneLine()}
098  *   </ul>
099 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
100 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
101 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString() asString()}
102 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(WriterSerializer) asString(WriterSerializer)}
103 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(Function) asString(Function)}
104 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJson() asJson()}
105 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJsonSorted() asJsonSorted()}
106 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asTransformed(Function) asApplied(Function)}
107 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asAny() asAny()}
108 * </ul>
109 * </ul>
110 *
111 * <h5 class='topic'>Configuration Methods</h5>
112 * <p>
113 * <ul class='javatree'>
114 *    <li class='jc'>{@link Assertion}
115 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
116 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setMsg(String, Object...) setMsg(String, Object...)}
117 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setOut(PrintStream) setOut(PrintStream)}
118 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setSilent() setSilent()}
119 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setStdOut() setStdOut()}
120 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setThrowable(Class) setThrowable(Class)}
121 *    </ul>
122 * </ul>
123 *
124 * <ul class='seealso'>
125 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Overview &gt; juneau-assertions &gt; Overview</a>
126 * </ul>
127 *
128 * @param <R> The return type.
129 */
130@FluentSetters(returns="FluentStringAssertion<R>")
131public class FluentStringAssertion<R> extends FluentObjectAssertion<String,R> {
132
133   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
134   // Static
135   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
136
137   private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(FluentStringAssertion.class, "Messages");
138   private static final String
139      MSG_stringDifferedAtPosition = MESSAGES.getString("stringDifferedAtPosition"),
140      MSG_expectedStringHadDifferentNumbersOfLines = MESSAGES.getString("expectedStringHadDifferentNumbersOfLines"),
141      MSG_expectedStringHadDifferentValuesAtLine = MESSAGES.getString("expectedStringHadDifferentValuesAtLine"),
142      MSG_stringEqualedUnexpected = MESSAGES.getString("stringEqualedUnexpected"),
143      MSG_stringDidNotContainExpectedSubstring = MESSAGES.getString("stringDidNotContainExpectedSubstring"),
144      MSG_stringContainedUnexpectedSubstring = MESSAGES.getString("stringContainedUnexpectedSubstring"),
145      MSG_stringWasNotEmpty = MESSAGES.getString("stringWasNotEmpty"),
146      MSG_stringWasNull = MESSAGES.getString("stringWasNull"),
147      MSG_stringWasEmpty = MESSAGES.getString("stringWasEmpty"),
148      MSG_stringDidNotMatchExpectedPattern = MESSAGES.getString("stringDidNotMatchExpectedPattern"),
149      MSG_stringDidNotStartWithExpected = MESSAGES.getString("stringDidNotStartWithExpected"),
150      MSG_stringDidNotEndWithExpected = MESSAGES.getString("stringDidNotEndWithExpected");
151
152   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
153   // Instance
154   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
155
156   private boolean javaStrings;
157
158   /**
159    * Constructor.
160    *
161    * @param value
162    *    The object being tested.
163    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
164    * @param returns
165    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
166    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
167    * used on the same assertion.
168    */
169   public FluentStringAssertion(String value, R returns) {
170      this(null, value, returns);
171   }
172
173   /**
174    * Chained constructor.
175    *
176    * <p>
177    * Used when transforming one assertion into another so that the assertion config can be used by the new assertion.
178    *
179    * @param creator
180    *    The assertion that created this assertion.
181    *    <br>Should be <jk>null</jk> if this is the top-level assertion.
182    * @param value
183    *    The object being tested.
184    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
185    * @param returns
186    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
187    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
188    * used on the same assertion.
189    */
190   public FluentStringAssertion(Assertion creator, String value, R returns) {
191      super(creator, value, returns);
192   }
193
194   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
195   // Config methods
196   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
197
198   /**
199    * When enabled, text in the message is converted to valid Java strings.
200    *
201    * <p class='bjava'>
202    *    <jv>value</jv>.replaceAll(<js>"\\\\"</js>, <js>"\\\\\\\\"</js>).replaceAll(<js>"\n"</js>, <js>"\\\\n"</js>).replaceAll(<js>"\t"</js>, <js>"\\\\t"</js>);
203    * </p>
204    *
205    * @return This object.
206    */
207   @FluentSetter
208   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asJavaStrings() {
209      this.javaStrings = true;
210      return this;
211   }
212
213   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
214   // Transform methods
215   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
216
217   @Override /* FluentObjectAssertion */
218   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asTransformed(Function<String,String> function) {
219      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, function.apply(orElse(null)), returns());
220   }
221
222   /**
223    * Performs the specified regular expression replacement on the underlying string.
224    *
225    * @param regex The regular expression to which this string is to be matched.
226    * @param replacement The string to be substituted for each match.
227    * @return This object.
228    */
229   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asReplaceAll(String regex, String replacement) {
230      assertArgNotNull("regex", regex);
231      assertArgNotNull("replacement", replacement);
232      return asTransformed(x -> x == null ? null : x.replaceAll(regex, replacement));
233   }
234
235   /**
236    * Performs the specified substring replacement on the underlying string.
237    *
238    * @param target The sequence of char values to be replaced.
239    * @param replacement The replacement sequence of char values.
240    * @return This object.
241    */
242   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asReplace(String target, String replacement) {
243      assertArgNotNull("target", target);
244      assertArgNotNull("replacement", replacement);
245      return asTransformed(x -> x == null ? null : x.replace(target, replacement));
246   }
247
248   /**
249    * URL-decodes the text in this assertion.
250    *
251    * @return This object.
252    */
253   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asUrlDecode() {
254      return asTransformed(StringUtils::urlDecode);
255   }
256
257   /**
258    * Converts the text to lowercase.
259    *
260    * @return This object.
261    */
262   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asLc() {
263      return asTransformed(x->x == null ? null : x.toLowerCase());
264   }
265
266   /**
267    * Converts the text to uppercase.
268    *
269    * @return This object.
270    */
271   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asUc() {
272      return asTransformed(x->x == null ? null : x.toUpperCase());
273   }
274
275   /**
276    * Splits the string into lines.
277    *
278    * @return This object.
279    */
280   public FluentListAssertion<String,R> asLines() {
281      return asSplit("[\r\n]+");
282   }
283
284   /**
285    * Splits the string into lines using the specified regular expression.
286    *
287    * @param regex The delimiting regular expression
288    * @return This object.
289    */
290   public FluentListAssertion<String,R> asSplit(String regex) {
291      assertArgNotNull("regex", regex);
292      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : Arrays.asList(value().trim().split(regex)), returns());
293   }
294
295   /**
296    * Returns the length of this string as an integer assertion.
297    *
298    * @return This object.
299    */
300   public FluentIntegerAssertion<R> asLength() {
301      return new FluentIntegerAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : value().length(), returns());
302   }
303
304   /**
305    * Removes any newlines from the string.
306    *
307    * @return This object.
308    */
309   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asOneLine() {
310      return asTransformed(x->x == null ? null : x.replaceAll("\\s*[\r\n]+\\s*","  "));
311   }
312
313   /**
314    * Removes any leading/trailing whitespace from the string.
315    *
316    * @return This object.
317    */
318   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asTrimmed() {
319      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : value().trim(), returns());
320   }
321
322   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
323   // Test methods
324   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
325
326   /**
327    * Asserts that the text equals the specified value.
328    *
329    * <p>
330    * Similar to {@link #is(String)} except error message states diff position.
331    *
332    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
333    * <p class='bjava'>
334    *    <jc>// Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK".</jc>
335    *    <jv>client</jv>
336    *       .get(<jsf>URL</jsf>)
337    *       .run()
338    *       .assertContent().is(<js>"OK"</js>);
339    * </p>
340    *
341    * @param value
342    *    The value to check against.
343    *    <br>If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
344    * @return The fluent return object.
345    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
346    */
347   @Override
348   public R is(String value) throws AssertionError {
349      String s = orElse(null);
350      if (ne(value, s))
351         throw error(MSG_stringDifferedAtPosition, diffPosition(value, s), fix(value), fix(s));
352      return returns();
353   }
354
355   /**
356    * Asserts that the text equals the specified value.
357    *
358    * @param value The value to check against.
359    * @return The fluent return object.
360    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
361    */
362   @Override
363   public R isNot(String value) throws AssertionError {
364      String s = orElse(null);
365      if (eq(value, s))
366         throw error(MSG_stringEqualedUnexpected, fix(s));
367      return returns();
368   }
369
370   /**
371    * Asserts that the lines of text equals the specified value.
372    *
373    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
374    * <p class='bjava'>
375    *    <jc>// Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK".</jc>
376    *    <jv>client</jv>
377    *       .get(<jsf>URL</jsf>)
378    *       .run()
379    *       .assertContent().isLines(
380    *          <js>"Line 1"</js>,
381    *          <js>"Line 2"</js>,
382    *          <js>"Line 3"</js>
383    *       );
384    * </p>
385    *
386    * @param lines
387    *    The value to check against.
388    *    <br>If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
389    * @return The fluent return object.
390    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
391    */
392   public R isLines(String...lines) throws AssertionError {
393      assertArgNotNull("lines", lines);
394      String v = join(lines, '\n');
395      String s = value();
396      if (ne(v, s))
397         throw error(MSG_stringDifferedAtPosition, diffPosition(v, s), fix(v), fix(s));
398      return returns();
399   }
400
401   /**
402    * Asserts that the text equals the specified value after splitting both by newlines and sorting the rows.
403    *
404    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
405    * <p class='bjava'>
406    *    <jc>// Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK".</jc>
407    *    <jv>client</jv>
408    *       .get(<jsf>URL</jsf>)
409    *       .run()
410    *       .assertContent().isSortedLines(
411    *          <js>"Line 1"</js>,
412    *          <js>"Line 2"</js>,
413    *          <js>"Line 3"</js>
414    *       );
415    * </p>
416    *
417    * @param lines
418    *    The value to check against.
419    *    <br>If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
420    * @return The fluent return object.
421    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
422    */
423   public R isSortedLines(String...lines) {
424      assertArgNotNull("lines", lines);
425
426      // Must work for windows too.
427      String[] e = StringUtils.join(lines, '\n').trim().split("[\r\n]+"), a = value().trim().split("[\r\n]+");
428
429      if (e.length != a.length)
430         throw error(MSG_expectedStringHadDifferentNumbersOfLines, e.length, a.length);
431
432      Arrays.sort(e);
433      Arrays.sort(a);
434
435      for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++)
436         if (! e[i].equals(a[i]))
437            throw error(MSG_expectedStringHadDifferentValuesAtLine, i+1, e[i], a[i]);
438
439      return returns();
440   }
441
442   /**
443    * Asserts that the text equals the specified value ignoring case.
444    *
445    * @param value The value to check against.
446    * @return The fluent return object.
447    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
448    */
449   public R isIc(String value) throws AssertionError {
450      String s = orElse(null);
451      if (neic(value, s))
452         throw error(MSG_stringDifferedAtPosition, diffPositionIc(value, s), fix(value), fix(s));
453      return returns();
454   }
455
456   /**
457    * Asserts that the text does not equal the specified value ignoring case.
458    *
459    * @param value The value to check against.
460    * @return The fluent return object.
461    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
462    */
463   public R isNotIc(String value) throws AssertionError {
464      String s = orElse(null);
465      if (eqic(value, s))
466         throw error(MSG_stringEqualedUnexpected, fix(s));
467      return returns();
468   }
469
470   /**
471    * Asserts that the text contains all of the specified substrings.
472    *
473    * @param values The values to check against.
474    * @return The fluent return object.
475    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
476    */
477   public R isContains(String...values) throws AssertionError {
478      assertArgNotNull("values", values);
479      String s = orElse(null);
480      for (String substring : values)
481         if (substring != null && ! StringUtils.contains(s, substring))
482            throw error(MSG_stringDidNotContainExpectedSubstring, fix(substring), fix(s));
483      return returns();
484   }
485
486   /**
487    * Asserts that the text doesn't contain any of the specified substrings.
488    *
489    * @param values The values to check against.
490    * @return The fluent return object.
491    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
492    */
493   public R isNotContains(String...values) throws AssertionError {
494      assertArgNotNull("values", values);
495      String s = orElse(null);
496      for (String substring : values)
497         if (substring != null && StringUtils.contains(s, substring))
498            throw error(MSG_stringContainedUnexpectedSubstring, fix(substring), fix(s));
499      return returns();
500   }
501
502   /**
503    * Asserts that the text is empty.
504    *
505    * @return The fluent return object.
506    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
507    */
508   public R isEmpty() throws AssertionError {
509      String s = orElse(null);
510      if (s != null && ! s.isEmpty())
511         throw error(MSG_stringWasNotEmpty, fix(s));
512      return returns();
513   }
514
515   /**
516    * Asserts that the text is not null or empty.
517    *
518    * @return The fluent return object.
519    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
520    */
521   public R isNotEmpty() throws AssertionError {
522      String s = orElse(null);
523      if (s == null)
524         throw error(MSG_stringWasNull);
525      if (s.isEmpty())
526         throw error(MSG_stringWasEmpty);
527      return returns();
528   }
529
530   /**
531    * Asserts that the text matches the specified pattern containing <js>"*"</js> meta characters.
532    *
533    * <p>
534    * The <js>"*"</js> meta character can be used to represent zero or more characters..
535    *
536    * @param searchPattern The search pattern.
537    * @return The fluent return object.
538    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
539    */
540   public R isMatches(String searchPattern) throws AssertionError {
541      assertArgNotNull("searchPattern", searchPattern);
542      return isPattern(getMatchPattern(searchPattern));
543   }
544
545   /**
546    * Asserts that the text matches the specified regular expression.
547    *
548    * @param regex The pattern to test for.
549    * @return The fluent return object.
550    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
551    */
552   public R isPattern(String regex) throws AssertionError {
553      return isPattern(regex, 0);
554   }
555
556   /**
557    * Asserts that the text matches the specified regular expression.
558    *
559    * @param regex The pattern to test for.
560    * @param flags Pattern match flags.  See {@link Pattern#compile(String, int)}.
561    * @return The fluent return object.
562    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
563    */
564   public R isPattern(String regex, int flags) throws AssertionError {
565      assertArgNotNull("regex", regex);
566      Pattern p = Pattern.compile(regex, flags);
567      String s = value();
568      if (! p.matcher(s).matches())
569         throw error(MSG_stringDidNotMatchExpectedPattern, fix(regex), fix(s));
570      return returns();
571   }
572
573   /**
574    * Asserts that the text matches the specified regular expression pattern.
575    *
576    * @param pattern The pattern to test for.
577    * @return The fluent return object.
578    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
579    */
580   public R isPattern(Pattern pattern) throws AssertionError {
581      assertArgNotNull("pattern", pattern);
582      String s = value();
583      if (! pattern.matcher(s).matches())
584         throw error(MSG_stringDidNotMatchExpectedPattern, fix(pattern.pattern()), fix(s));
585      return returns();
586   }
587
588   /**
589    * Asserts that the text starts with the specified string.
590    *
591    * @param string The string to test for.
592    * @return The fluent return object.
593    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
594    */
595   public R isStartsWith(String string) {
596      assertArgNotNull("string", string);
597      String s = value();
598      if (! s.startsWith(string))
599         throw error(MSG_stringDidNotStartWithExpected, fix(string), fix(s));
600      return returns();
601   }
602
603   /**
604    * Asserts that the text ends with the specified string.
605    *
606    * @param string The string to test for.
607    * @return The fluent return object.
608    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
609    */
610   public R isEndsWith(String string) {
611      assertArgNotNull("string", string);
612      String s = value();
613      if (! s.endsWith(string))
614         throw error(MSG_stringDidNotEndWithExpected, fix(string), fix(s));
615      return returns();
616   }
617
618   /**
619    * Asserts that the text equals the specified object after calling {@link #toString()} on the object.
620    *
621    * @param value The value to check against.
622    * @return The fluent return object.
623    */
624   public R isString(Object value) {
625      return is(value == null ? null : toString());
626   }
627
628   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
629   // Fluent setters
630   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
631
632   // <FluentSetters>
633
634   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
635   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setMsg(String msg, Object...args) {
636      super.setMsg(msg, args);
637      return this;
638   }
639
640   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
641   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setOut(PrintStream value) {
642      super.setOut(value);
643      return this;
644   }
645
646   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
647   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setSilent() {
648      super.setSilent();
649      return this;
650   }
651
652   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
653   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setStdOut() {
654      super.setStdOut();
655      return this;
656   }
657
658   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
659   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setThrowable(Class<? extends java.lang.RuntimeException> value) {
660      super.setThrowable(value);
661      return this;
662   }
663
664   // </FluentSetters>
665
666   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
667   // Utility methods
668   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
669
670   private String fix(String text) {
671      if (javaStrings)
672         text = text.replaceAll("\\\\", "\\\\\\\\").replaceAll("\n", "\\\\n").replaceAll("\t", "\\\\t");
673      return text;
674   }
675}
